column4: hi all, im trying to instal ndiswrapper right after a clean installation. When i try to install build essentials it tells me i need the dependancy libc6-dev, so i go to install that and it says i need libc6. i go to install that and it says i already have a newer version. What's going on then?
do not use strange repositories
that error means one of the packages depends on a specific libc6 version wich is not available on your system
do not install a newer libc6 package !
that ndiskrwrapper module that you are trying to compile is not compatible with your ubuntu kernel version
did you read my message about the ndiswrapper module that you trying to build being incompatible with your kernel version ?
it must be on the documentation or at some website, the kernel versions for which the modules is compatible with
now i just need to figure out which version of ndiswrapper to use
that should be easy to find on google, i guess someone id it already
btw, there is an ndiswrapper module on Feisty
does that mean i should already have it?
if so, how do i use it/make sure its working
well, i am not sure it is on the CD, it means you should grab it instead of the source
http://packages.ubuntu.com/cgi-bin/search_packages.pl?keywords=ndiswrapper&searchon=names&subword=1&version=feisty&release=all
my apologies, but i dont know what that means or how to do it
you need to download the packages, and their dependencies
all tthree packages you pointed me too and all their dependencies?
yes, but note that I am just researching, i don't use ndiswrapper
no problem. i guess im going to get started =)
I found a better documentation
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/Ndiswrapper
thank you--i will have a look
to install software you need to: sudo checkinstall make install
when do i run sudo checkinstall and sudo make install? after the configure?
